pageTitle: Adam Dunn’s self diagnosis: too many off-speed pitches early in the count [UPDATE] | White Sox news, Minor Leagues updates and more
TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {4790=http://www.beerleaguer.com/whitesox/2011/05/sunday-a-plan-to-fix-adam-dunn.html, 4996=Comment by The Wizard — July 20, 2011 @ July 20, 2011 5:53 pm | Reply, 3666=Comment by JRFegan — July 20, 2011 @ July 20, 2011 9:26 am | Reply, 1318=So, the non-4seam fastballs thrown to Dunn were 49.9%-53.1 on 2009, 59.6%-60.4% in 2010 and 53.3%-53.6% in 2011. Seems the pitch classification wasn’t good in 2008.}
textBeforeTable: 2011: Data from the the TexasLeaguers.com Pitch-F/X database: UPDATE: As James says don’t trust what Dunn says. Let’s take a look at the pitches thrown at Dunn on 0-0 counts. Unfortunately for Dunn, I don’t think we can order opposing pitchers what to throw. “And that’s not my game,” Dunn said. “Everything is there except me swinging at bad pitches,” Dunn continued. “I’m working the count, usually putting myself in usually good hitters’ counts but not making them pay.” Dunn believes his recent struggles stem from being too aggressive and that opposing pitchers are taking advantage by throwing off-speed pitches early in the count. Gonzales @ CT: Adam Dunn Tags: Chicago White Sox — The Wizard @ July 20, 2011 9:30 pm Filed under: Adam Dunn’s self diagnosis: too many off-speed pitches early in the count [UPDATE] July 20, 2011 White Sox news, Minor Leagues updates and more
